original_title: Through a Lens Darkly: Grief, Loss and C.S. Lewis
overview: "No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear." CS Lewis - A Grief Observed Loss comes in many forms: The grief over the death of a loved one, the devastation of a physical or mental impairment, the pain of divorce or separation, or the distress of job loss and foreclosure.
title: Through a Lens Darkly: Grief, Loss and C.S. Lewis
